practice.quadraticTwoFractions.mainProbl.oldText: Consider the equation <block-math/> Multiply all terms by <inline-math/> and simplify each resulting term as much as possible.
practice.quadraticTwoFractions.mainProbl.latestText: Consider the equation <block-math/> Multiply all terms by <inline-math/> and simplify each resulting term as much as possible.

practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step1.pro.oldText: Multiply both sides of the equation by <inline-math/>.
practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step1.pro.latestText: Multiply both sides of the equation by <inline-math/>.

practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step1.sol.oldText: When we multiply a side of an equation by <inline-math/> it is important to use brackets. Doing so results in <block-math/> Note that it does not matter if we put the multiplication on the left or on the right: this comes down to the same.

practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step2.pro.oldText: Expand all the brackets that are present.
practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step2.pro.latestText: Expand all the brackets that are present.

practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step2.sol.oldText: To expand the brackets, we multiply each of the terms within brackets separately by the factor outside of the brackets. This gives <block-math/> It is wise to already simplify the products a bit further, giving us <block-math/>

practice.quadraticTwoFractions.step3.pro.oldText: Simplify each of the resulting terms as much as possible.
